item.title: Yield Losses in Chickpea (Cicer arietinum L.) with Varying Densities of Euphorbia dracunculoides L.
item.description: Knowledge of economic threshold level and growth habits of weeds in chickpea is essential to implement timely, effective, and economical weed control treatments. The effect of weed density on growth and yield performance in chickpea using dragon spurge as a test weed was investigated for 2 consecutive yr. Dragon spurge density levels of 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30, 35, and 40 plants m???2 were compared with weed-free plots. Each increment in densities of dragon spurge from 5 to 40 plants m?
